As soon as I decided to help Akane, I started\nthinking of how to do it.%K%P
I asked Inori to talk to goddesses she knew, and\ngot Maika to find out whatever she could on the\nnet when she had time.%K%P
They were both happy to help, things being what\nthey were.%K%P
That left me - going to the library during the\nday and looking for clues on the net at night.%K%P
But none of this turned up anything useful, and\nwe just burned up time.%K%P
'*Sigh* Huh...'%K%P
I sighed as I walked home from the library,\ntrying to shake off my thoughts.%K%P
It had been another day with very little\nprogress made.%K%P
'Hm, maybe this will give us a clue.'%K%P
In one book about goddesses I'd found, there was\nmention of 'spiritual balance.'%K%P
It seemed like maybe right now, Akane's\nspiritual balance was off, and it could be\ncausing her troubles.%K%P
'So then the problem is, what caused the\nunbalance?'%K%P
I felt it was unlikely to be her rehabilitation.%K%P
If that was the cause, then there should have\nbeen some similar case with all the other\nAragami that had been rehabilitated.%K%P
But since there was no mention of that anywhere,\nthere must be some other reason.%K%P
'For now, I'll just ask Maika and Inori what\nthey think... Huh?'%K%P
'Hey, Sho!'%K%P
Akane came running toward me, waving her hand.%K%P
'Akane? What's up?'%K%P
'Oh, nothing really. I just thought I'd come\nmeet you.'%K%P
'Meet me? How'd you find me?'%K%P
'I heard from Maika that you've been going to\nthe library. I figured if I waited here you'd\ncome along.'%K%P
'Ah, yeah. Thanks for coming to meet me!'%K%P
'No big deal! I was bored anyway. And I always\nfeel so comfortable with you.'%K%P
My heart lifted when she said that.%K%P
It made me happy to hear it so casually.%K%P
'Huh? What's with you?'%K%P
'N-Nothing. So anyway, how's your Jinriki? Feel\nlike it's coming back?'%K%P
'Nope. It's no good. It's dead silent.'%K%P
Akane shrugged and laughed like she'd made a\njoke.%K%P
'Sorry. I've been looking and looking, but I\nhaven't found any clues on bringing it back.'%K%P
'Why are you apologizing? It's not your fault my\nJinriki's gone.'%K%P
'I mean, it looks like you've been working hard,\nI'm the one who should apologize.'%K%P
'Well, it's not done any good yet, so it's as\ngood as nothing. I'll look more tomorr--'%K%P
'I don't mind if it doesn't come back.'%K%P
Akane interrupted me.%K%P
'What are you talking about, Akane?'%K%P
'I mean, if it never comes back, I don't have to\nworry about causing blackouts, right?'%K%P
'And then they won't tear down Tsubaki, and\nthat's what you want, right?'%K%P
She was obviously putting a positive spin on it.%K%P
'Don't be ridiculous! Of course I want to save\nthe apartments. But that's no reason to just\naccept that your power is all gone!'%K%P
I couldn't accept Akane giving up like that.%K%P
At the same time, I was upset at myself for how\nI was acting.%K%P
I wanted to help her, but my constant failure\nwas wearing at me.%K%P
'Are you really okay with not getting your power\nback?'%K%P
'...Of course not. I want it back if it's\npossible at all.%K%P
'But if it does come back, then I might cause\nmore blackouts and bother people.'%K%P
'And you're the one who'll suffer the most.'%K%P
'Are you okay with that?'%K%P
Oh, no. So that was what she was worried about.%K%P
'So you might cause blackouts. So what? If you\nget your power back and are about to cause a\nblackout, I'll stop you.'%K%P
'I told you! No matter what happens, I'm by your\nside until the end!'%K%P
'That's right. You said you'd stick with me.'%K%P
'It's not like me to be so nervous.'%K%P
After she'd been trying so hard lately, it was\nnice to see a real smile on her face.%K%P
It was a relief to see her feeling better.%K%P
'Exactly. Just like when you were sick in bed.\nNow you're just worried about your Jinriki.'%K%P
'But just relax.'%K%P
I said it casually, on purpose, and Akane looked\ndown in thought.%K%P
'Well, let's get home before it gets late.\nMaika's probably getting worried.'%K%P
'Why are you...so nice to me, Sho?'%K%P
'Huh? Did you say something?'%K%P
'No, nothing. Never mind, let's just hurry!\nDinner's waiting!'%K%P
I took Akane by the hand and we walked back home\nthat way.%K%P
